channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Inside the Messy, Accidental Kryptos Reveal
item.description: After 35 years, the secretive CIA sculpture finally gave up its mystery, thanks to a novelist, a playwright, and some misplaced documents. But the cha...

item.title: OpenAI's Sora Loses Its Top App Store Ranking to Dave's Hot Chicken
item.description: Dave’s Hot Chicken is the top app in the iOS App Store, ending Sora’s weeks-long reign.

item.title: This Upgraded SteelSeries Gaming Headset Is $80 Off
item.description: Serious gamers take note, the Arctis Nova Pro is feature-packed and ready for anything.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: The browser wars are back, and this time they’re powered by AI
item.description: The browser wars are heating up again, this time with AI in the driver’s seat. OpenAI just launched Atlas, a ChatGPT-powered browser that lets users s...

item.title: How to use the new ChatGPT app integrations, including Spotify, Figma, Canva, and others
item.description: Learn how to use Spotify, Canva, Figma, Expedia, and other apps directly in ChatGPT.

item.title: Instagram’s latest feature lets you go back to see your watched Reels
item.description: With this new feature, users can go back and find videos they might not have had the chance to save.

item.title: Arbor’s ‘vegetarian rocket engine’ power plant is actually an omnivore
item.description: As demand for electricity from data centers grows, Arbor Energy has made its power plant capable of burning natural gas in addition to biomass.

item.title: DHS Wants a Fleet of AI-Powered Surveillance Trucks

item.title: Astronomers Have Discovered Earth’s Latest Quasi-Lunar Moon
item.description: As mankind was planning the first moon landing in the 1960s, an asteroid approached Earth—and still hasn’t left.
